Related Publication.Citation: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae. Liang K et al 2018. MRA submitted.

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: We sequenced the genomes of eight isolates from various regions of the United States that show high sequence similarity to Vibrio sp. 2521-89, a recently reported genome(1). These isolates form a monophyletic cluster clearly related but distinct from V. cholerae, representing a highly divergent basal lineage or a potential novel species.

ore:describes.Title: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences

ore:aggregates.schema:description: Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) and in-silico DNA-DNA Hybridization (isDDH) for all pairwise comparisons between representative Vibrio cholerae strains and the eight isolates.
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Vibrio_metaData.xlsx

ore:aggregates.schema:description: 1000 bootstrap maximum likelihood tree with the eight isolates and representative Vibrio cholerae strains
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Vibrio_sp_1000BTS_MLtree.pdf

ore:aggregates.schema:description: 100 bootstrap tree. Vibrio sp ML tree created with RaxML. Includes representatives Vibrio cholerae strains and the eight additional isolates
ore:aggregates.schema:name: Vibrio_sp_100BTS_tree.pdf
